# Chord: Dominant 7#5 in E (Shape: C)

## Brief Description:
The Dominant 7#5 chord in the key of E is created using the C shape on the guitar fretboard. This chord is a colorful and exotic-sounding chord due to its augmented fifth (#5) interval. It consists of the root (E), major third (G#), augmented fifth (B# or C), and minor seventh (D) notes. This chord can add tension and interesting harmonic flavor to music compositions.

## Notes and Intervals:
- E (Root)
- G# (Major third)
- B# or C (Augmented fifth)
- D (Minor seventh)

## Genre and Flavor:
The Dominant 7#5 chord is often used in jazz, fusion, and other contemporary genres where musicians are looking to add a touch of tension and sophistication to their compositions. This chord has a dissonant yet colorful sound that can create a sense of intrigue and unpredictability in music.
